info.title: DocuSign Click API
info.description: Elastic signing (also known as DocuSign Click)  lets you capture consent to standard agreement terms with a single click: terms and conditions, terms of service, terms of use, privacy policies, and more. The Click API lets you include this customizable elastic template solution in your DocuSign integrations.

externalDocs.description: See the DocuSign Click API Guide for more information.

get.summary: Gets the current version and other information about the Click API.
Gets all the elastic templates for a user.
get.description:
Gets all the elastic templates for a user.

**Note:** This endpoint returns a list of `clickwrapVersionSummaryResponse` objects. Each version of each elastic template is returned as a separate entry in the list.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Names of columns by which to filter and values to match on.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: The earliest date to return clickwraps from.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the elastic templates to return.

parameters.name: ownerUserId
parameters.description: The user ID of the owner.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description:
The results for this endpoint are paginated. Use this parameter to indicate which page to return. The `minimumPagesRemaining` value in the response indicates whether to continue querying for additional pages.

For example, if the page size is 40:
* If this property is set to 0 (the default), the endpoint returns results 1-40.
* If this property is set to 1, the endpoint returns results 41-80.

The default value is 0.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
The status of the elastic templates to filter by. One of:

- `active`
- `inactive`

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: The latest date to return clickwraps from.

post.summary: Creates an elastic template for an account.
post.description:
Creates an elastic template for an account and returns the response with created agreement.

The resulting elastic template has its `status` property set to `draft`,
and the `versionNumber` is `1.0`.

```json
{
    "accountId": ""624e3e00-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-43918c520dab",
    "clickwrapId": ""c3197231-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-6f34186eee23",
    "clickwrapName": "HTML Only",
    "versionId": ""e27b59e2-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-6a3b8b012ee8",
    "versionNumber": "1.0",
    "status": "draft",
    "createdTime": "2023-02-09T19:20:09.2150957Z",
    "lastModified": "2023-02-09T19:20:09.2150957Z",
    "lastModifiedBy": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
    "ownerUserId": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
    "draftVersionId": ""e27b59e2-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-6a3b8b012ee8",
    "owner": {
        "userId": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
        "userName": "Catherine Earnshaw",
        "email": "catherine@example.com"
    },
    "dataFields": []
}
```

Use [ClickWraps: updateClickwrap](/docs/click-api/reference/accounts/clickwraps/updateclickwrap/)
with a request body like this to make the elastic template active:

```json
{
"status": "active"
}
```

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

delete.summary: Deletes elastic templates for an account.
delete.description:
Deletes the elastic templates for an account specified in the
`clickwrapIds` query parameter.
Active elastic templates cannot be deleted.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

The response is a list of deleted elastic templates
along with their dispostition:

```json
{
  "clickwraps": [
    {
      "clickwrapId": ""798d8186-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-abc22eb46640",
      "clickwrapName": "Archive this",
      "status": "Active",
      "deletionMessage": "Active clickwrap version cannot be deleted."
    },
    {
      "clickwrapId": ""3390d1cb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-fcbf0bd9ee13",
      "clickwrapName": "Mesoamerica 101",
      "status": "Deleted",
      "deletionSuccess": true,
      "deletionMessage": "Successfully deleted the clickwrap."
    }
  ]
}
```

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of elastic template GUIDs to delete.

get.summary: Gets a  single elastic template object.
get.description:
Retrieves the definition of the specified elastic template.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

put.summary: Update properties of an elastic template.
put.description:
Updates the properties of an elastic
template.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

delete.summary: Deletes an elastic template and all of its versions.
delete.description:
Deletes the elastic template specified by `clickwrapId` and all of its versions.
Active elastic templates are not deleted

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: versions
parameters.description: Not used.

post.summary:
Creates a unique URL for the agreement
that you can embed in your application.
post.description:
Creates a unique URL for the elastic signing agreement
that you can embed in your application. The URL expires after one hour.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage` and `click.send`.

The request must include at least the
`clientUserId`. This is a value that you
generate to identify the unique recipient
of the agreement.

If you are using a [dynamic content][] document,
you can supply the values in the `documentData`
property of the request, like this:

```json
{
  "clientUserId": "cl-bc7f-48a9",
  "documentData": {
    "fullName": "T. J. Fanning",
    "email": "tj@example.com",
    "company": "Fanning Industries",
    "title": "Cat wrangler",
    "date": "2022-10-13T05:17:14-07:00"
  }
}
```

A response looks like this.
The `agreementUrl` is unique to the user identified by the `clientUserId`.
Your user can open the URL to approve the agreement.
The `documentData` property appears only if you provided it in the request.

```json
{
  "accountId": "624e3e00-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-43918c520dab",
  "clickwrapId": "0e64e4a7-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-ce5a93b162af",
  "clientUserId": "tcl-bc7f-48a9j",
  "agreementId": "1f346c7d-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-a5c968666785",
  "documents": [ . . .],
  "consumerDisclosureEnabled": true,
  "agreementUrl": "https://demo.docusign.net/clickapi/v1/redeem?agreementToken=AcTZT8g ... cxEqrUsA1lQ8DPPy05dE0",
  "createdOn": "2022-10-20T16:27:25.1287685Z",
  "status": "created",
  "versionId": "5957716d-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-e1594f00ff12",
  "versionNumber": 1,
  "settings": {
    "displayName": "Agree with me",
    "hasDeclineButton": true,
    . . .
    "statementAlignment": "bottom"
  },
  "documentData": {
    "fullName": "T. J. Fanning",
    "email": "tj@example.com",
    "company": "Fanning Indusdtries",
    "title": "Cat wrangler",
    "date": "2022-10-13T05:17:14-07:00"
  }
}
```


A successful response always includes
the following response. The response code
is different, depending on whether
the user has agreed:

| Response code | Meaning                  | Notes                                                             |
| :------------ | :----------------------  | :---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 200           | User has agreed.         | The `agreementUrl` property does not appear in the response body. |
| 201           | User has not yet agreed. |                                                                   |


### Related topics

- [Add dynamic content to your elastic template][dynamic content]
- [How to embed an elastic template][embed-howto]


[dynamic content]:  /docs/click-api/click101/customize-elastic-template-fields/#add-dynamic-content-to-your-elastic-template
[embed-howto]:      /docs/click-api/how-to/embed-elastic-templates/

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

get.summary: Gets a specific agreement for a specified elastic template.
get.description:
Gets the agreement specified by `agreementId`.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage` or `click.send`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: agreementId
parameters.description: The agreement ID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

get.summary: Gets the completed user agreement PDF.
get.description:
Gets the PDF of  `agreementId` for the clickwrap specified by `clickwrapId`.

The response to this method is the bytes of the PDF file.
The response includes the HTTP header `application/pdf`.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage` or `click.send`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: agreementId
parameters.description: The agreement ID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: include_coc
parameters.description: When **true,** the Certificate of Completion will be appended to the PDF. The default value is **false.**

post.summary: Starts an export of clickwrap agreements for a specified date range.
post.description:
Starts an asynchronus process to export elastic template agreements
for a date range and status specified in the request body.

An email will be sent to the creator after it has been processed.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

get.description:
Retrieves the user agreements for a specified elastic template. Each `userAgreementResponse` object describes a single user's response to the elastic signing agreement. You can also filter the agreements by date, status, page number, and client user ID.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: client_user_id
parameters.description: The client ID.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: The earliest date to return agreements from.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description:
The results for this endpoint are paginated. Use this parameter to indicate which page to return. The `minimumPagesRemaining` value in the response indicates whether to continue querying for additional pages.

For example, if the page size is 40:
* If this property is set to 0 (the default), the endpoint returns results 1-40.
* If this property is set to 1, the endpoint returns results 41-80.

The default value is 0.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the elastic templates to return.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: The latest date to return agreements from.

get.summary: Gets all the versions of an elastic template.
get.description:
Gets all the versions of an elastic template for an account.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

This example shows three versions:
two major versions (1.0 and 2.0), and one minor version (2.1).

```json
{
  "accountId": ""624e3e00-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-43918c520dab",
  "clickwrapId": ""b4cb1e3a-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-3b3c21b853ea",
  "clickwrapName": "The name of this",
  "versions": [
    {
      "versionId": ""0df7af2d-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-c2b960b73fef",
      "versionNumber": "2.1",
      "status": "active",
      "createdTime": "2023-02-24T01:45:21.0138703Z",
      "lastModified": "2023-02-24T01:45:25.8540652Z",
      "lastModifiedBy": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
      "requireReacceptance": false,
      "ownerUserId": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
      "dataFields": []
    },
    {
      "versionId": ""4976a2f5-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-dc1fd3b97c15",
      "versionNumber": "2.0",
      "status": "inactive",
      "createdTime": "2023-02-24T01:36:07.6852505Z",
      "lastModified": "2023-02-24T01:45:25.8853154Z",
      "lastModifiedBy": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
      "requireReacceptance": true,
      "ownerUserId": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
      "dataFields": []
    },
    {
      "versionId": ""987e83d7-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-5348c4f89dca",
      "versionNumber": "1.0",
      "status": "inactive",
      "createdTime": "2023-02-24T01:17:59.806101Z",
      "lastModified": "2023-02-24T01:36:11.1843708Z",
      "lastModifiedBy": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
      "requireReacceptance": true,
      "ownerUserId": ""7c430bdb-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-538c11111ff7",
      "dataFields": []
    }
  ],
  "page": 0,
  "pageSize": 40,
  "minimumPagesRemaining": 0
}

```

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

post.summary: Creates a new elastic template version.
post.description:
Creates a new version of an existing elastic template.
In a new version, you can replace the uploaded documents,
change the display settings,
and change the name of the elastic template.

If the `requireReacceptance` property of the request body is **false,**
the minor version number is incremented. When this property is **true,**
the major version number is incremented, and the minor version number
is reset to zero.


[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

delete.summary: Deletes the versions of an elastic template.
delete.description:
Deletes all versions of an elastic template,
or only the ones specified in the
`clickwrapVersionIds` query parameter.

**Note:** Be sure to check the `deletionSuccess` and `deletionMessage` properties in the response.


[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: clickwrapVersionIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of elastic template version IDs to delete.

get.summary: Gets a specific version of an elastic template by version ID.
get.description:
Gets the version specified by `versionId`  from the elastic template `clickwrapId`.
The `versionId` can be the version's `versionId` GUID or the `versionNumber` string.


[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description:
The ID of the version.
This value can be the version's GUID or the version string, such as `1.3`.

put.summary: Update properties of an elastic template by its version ID.
put.description:
Updates the properties of an elastic
template version specified by `versionId`.


The `versionId` can be the version's `versionId` GUID or the `versionNumber` string.


[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description:
The ID of the version.
This value can be the version's GUID or the version string, such as `1.3`.

delete.summary: Deletes an elastic template version by version ID.
delete.description:
Deletes the elastic template version specified by `versionId` of the elastic template specified by `clickwrapId`.

**Note:** Be sure to check the `deletionSuccess` and `deletionMessage` properties of the response.
In some cases `deletionSuccess` may be **false** even though the HTTP request response may be `200 (OK)`.
[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description:
The ID of the version.
This value can be the version's GUID or the version string, such as `1.3`.

get.summary: Downloads a document at an order within the agreement.
get.description:
Downloads a specific document from the agreement presented to the user.

[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.sign`

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: orderOrDisclosure
parameters.description: The order of the document or consumer_disclosure.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description:
The ID of the version.
This value can be the version's GUID or the version string, such as `1.3`.

get.summary: Gets the agreement responses for an elastic template version by version ID.
get.description:
Gets the agreement responses for a specific version.


[Required authentication scopes](/docs/click-api/click101/auth/): `click.manage`.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

parameters.name: clickwrapId
parameters.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description:
The ID of the version.
This value can be the version's GUID or the version string, such as `1.3`.

parameters.name: client_user_id
parameters.description: The client user ID to filter to a single user's agreements.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: The earliest date to return agreements from.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description:
The results for this endpoint are paginated. Use this parameter to indicate which page to return. The `minimumPagesRemaining` value in the response indicates whether to continue querying for additional pages.

For example, if the page size is 40:
* If this property is set to 0 (the default), the endpoint returns results 1-40.
* If this property is set to 1, the endpoint returns results 41-80.

The default value is 0.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Elastic template status. Possible values:

- `active`
- `inactive`
- `deleted`

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: The latest date to return agreements from.

bulkClickwrapRequest.description: Data used to start a bulk agreements export.

fromDate.description: The earliest date to return agreements from.

toDate.description: The latest date to return agreements from.

bulkClickwrapRequest.x-ms-summary: Data used to start a bulk agreements export.

minimumPagesRemaining.description: Number of pages remaining in the response.

page.description: The number of the current page.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page.

clickwrapAgreementsResponse.description:
The results are paginated.
Use the following properties to navigate the pages.
Use the `page_number` query parameter to specify a page.

- `page`: The page number of the current results.
- `pageSize`: The number of results in the current page.
- `minimumPagesRemaining`: The number of pages that follow this one.
clickwrapAgreementsResponse.x-ms-summary:
The results are paginated.
Use the following properties to navigate the pages.
Use the `page_number` query parameter to specify a page.

- `page`: The page number of the current results.
- `pageSize`: The number of results in the current page.
- `minimumPagesRemaining`: The number of pages that follow this one.

clickwrapDeleteResponse.description: The result of a clickwrap deletion request.

clickwrapId.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

clickwrapName.description: The name of the elastic template.

deletionMessage.description:
A message describing the result of deletion request. One of:

- `alreadyDeleted`: Elastic template is already deleted.
- `deletionSuccess`: Successfully deleted the elastic template.
- `deletionFailure`: Failed to delete the elastic template.
- `cannotDelete`: Active elastic template versions cannot be deleted.

deletionSuccess.description: **True** if the elastic template was deleted successfully. **False** otherwise.

clickwrapDeleteResponse.x-ms-summary: The result of a clickwrap deletion request.

clickwrapRequest.description: Request body for working with elastic templates.

clickwrapName.description:
The name of the elastic template.

Required in [ClickWraps: createClickwrap](/docs/click-api/reference/accounts/clickwraps/createclickwrap/).

dataFields.description: An array of data fields available to be inserted into the documents.

displaySettings.description: Display settings for the elastic template. This object is required.

documents.description: An array of documents. This object is required.

fieldsToNull.description:
Specifies whether `scheduledReacceptance` and `scheduledDate` should be cleared. May be one of:

- `"scheduledReacceptance"`
- `"scheduledDate"`
- `"scheduledReacceptance,scheduledDate"`

isShared.description: When **true,** indicates that the elastic template is shared with one or more users in the account.

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true,** requires signers who have previously agreed to this
elastic signing agreement to sign again.
The major version number is incremented, and the minor version number is set to zero.
For example:  `2.1` to `3.0`

When **false,** signers who have previously agreed do not need to sign again.
Only the minor version number is incremented. For example:  `2.1` to `2.2`

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this elastic template is activated.

scheduledReacceptance.description: Specifies the interval between reacceptances in days, weeks, months, or years.

status.description:
Status of an elastic template. This property is read-only. Possible values:

- `active`
- `inactive`
- `deleted`

transferFromUserId.description: Not used. To update the user ID of an elastic template, use the [updateClickwrap](/docs/click-api/reference/accounts/clickwraps/updateclickwrap/) endpoint.

transferToUserId.description: Not used. To update the user ID of an elastic template, use the [updateClickwrap](/docs/click-api/reference/accounts/clickwraps/updateclickwrap/) endpoint.

clickwrapRequest.x-ms-summary: Request body for working with elastic templates.

recurrenceInterval.description:
The time between recurrences specified in `recurrenceIntervalType` units.

The minimum and maximum values depend on `recurrenceIntervalType`:

- `days`: 1 - 365
- `weeks`: 1 - 52
- `months`: 1 - 12
- `years`: 1

recurrenceIntervalType.description:
The units of the `recurrenceInterval`. Must be one of:

- `days`
- `weeks`
- `month`
- `years`

startDateTime.description: The date when the recurrence interval starts.

clickwraps.description: An array of clickwrap deletion results.

clickwrapTransferRequest.description: Data used to transfer a clickwrap from one user to another.

transferFromUserId.description: ID of the user to transfer from. This property is required.

transferToUserId.description: ID of the user to transfer to. This property is required.

clickwrapTransferRequest.x-ms-summary: Data used to transfer a clickwrap from one user to another.

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique GUID of this elastic template version.

createdTime.description: The time that the elastic template was created.

lastModified.description: The time that the elastic template was last modified.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user GUID of the last user who modified this elastic template.

ownerUserId.description: The user GUID of the owner of this clickwrap.

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true,** requires signers who have previously agreed to this
elastic signing agreement to sign again.
The major version number is incremented, and the minor version number is set to zero.
For example:  `2.1` to `3.0`

When **false,** signers who have previously agreed do not need to sign again.
Only the minor version number is incremented. For example:  `2.1` to `2.2`

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this elastic template is activated.

scheduledReacceptance.description: Specifies the interval between reacceptances in days, weeks, months, or years.

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique GUID of this elastic template version.

createdTime.description: The time that the elastic template was created.

deletionMessage.description:
A message describing the result of deletion request. One of:

- `alreadyDeleted`: Elastic template is already deleted.
- `deletionSuccess`: Successfully deleted the elastic template.
- `deletionFailure`: Failed to delete the elastic template.
- `cannotDelete`: Active elastic template versions cannot be deleted.

deletionSuccess.description: **True** if the elastic template was deleted successfully. **False** otherwise.

lastModified.description: The time that the elastic template was last modified.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user GUID of the last user who modified this elastic template.

ownerUserId.description: The user ID of the owner of this clickwrap.

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true,** requires signers who have previously agreed to this
elastic signing agreement to sign again.
The major version number is incremented, and the minor version number is set to zero.
For example:  `2.1` to `3.0`

When **false,** signers who have previously agreed do not need to sign again.
Only the minor version number is incremented. For example:  `2.1` to `2.2`

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this elastic template is activated.

scheduledReacceptance.description: Specifies the interval between reacceptances in days, weeks, months, or years.

accountId.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

clickwrapId.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

clickwrapName.description: The name of the elastic template.

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique GUID of this elastic template version.

createdTime.description: The time that the elastic template was created.

displaySettings.description: Display settings for an elastic template.

lastModified.description: The time that the elastic template was last modified.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user GUID of the last user who modified this elastic template.

ownerUserId.description: The user ID of the owner of this clickwrap.

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true,** requires signers who have previously agreed to this
elastic signing agreement to sign again.
The major version number is incremented, and the minor version number is set to zero.
For example:  `2.1` to `3.0`

When **false,** signers who have previously agreed do not need to sign again.
Only the minor version number is incremented. For example:  `2.1` to `2.2`

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this elastic template is activated.

scheduledReacceptance.description: Specifies the interval between reacceptances in days, weeks, months, or years.

clickwrapId.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

clickwrapName.description: The name of the elastic template.

clickwrapVersionsPagedResponse.description:
The results are paginated.
Use the following properties to navigate the pages.

- `page`: The page number of the current results.
- `pageSize`: The number of results in the current page.
- `minimumPagesRemaining`: The number of pages that follow this one.

accountId.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

clickwrapId.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

clickwrapName.description: The name of the elastic template.

page.description: The number of the current page.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page.

versions.description: An array of elastic template versions.

Use the following properties to navigate the pages.

- `page`: The page number of the current results.
- `pageSize`: The number of results in the current page.

clickwrapVersionsResponse.description:
The results are paginated.
Use the following properties to navigate the pages.
Use the `page_number` query parameter to specify a page.

- `page`: The page number of the current results.
- `pageSize`: The number of results in the current page.
- `minimumPagesRemaining`: The number of pages that follow this one.

minimumPagesRemaining.description: Number of pages remaining in the response.

page.description: The number of the current page.

clickwrapVersionsResponse.x-ms-summary:
The results are paginated.
Use the following properties to navigate the pages.
Use the `page_number` query parameter to specify a page.

- `page`: The page number of the current results.
- `pageSize`: The number of results in the current page.
- `minimumPagesRemaining`: The number of pages that follow this one.

accountId.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

clickwrapId.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

clickwrapName.description: The name of the elastic template.

clickwrapVersionId.description: The unique GUID of this elastic template version.

createdTime.description: The time that the elastic template was created.

lastModified.description: The time that the elastic template was last modified.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user GUID of the last user who modified this elastic template.

ownerUserId.description: The user ID of the owner of this clickwrap.

requireReacceptance.description:
When **true,** requires signers who have previously agreed to this
elastic signing agreement to sign again.
The major version number is incremented, and the minor version number is set to zero.
For example:  `2.1` to `3.0`

When **false,** signers who have previously agreed do not need to sign again.
Only the minor version number is incremented. For example:  `2.1` to `2.2`

scheduledDate.description: The time and date when this elastic template is activated.

scheduledReacceptance.description: Specifies the interval between reacceptances in days, weeks, months, or years.

label.description: The label of the datafield. This is the text that is displayed to the user.

name.description:
A string used to refer to the field internally. The name must be unique within an elastic template.

The following fields are predefined by the API:
- `fullName`
- `email`
- `company`
- `title`
- `date`

type.description:
The type of the field. Valid values:

- `STRING`
- `NUMBER`
- `DATE`

displaySettings.description: Information about how an agreement is displayed.

actionButtonAlignment.description:
Position of the Accept button in the agreement. One of 

- `right`
- `left`

allowClientOnly.description: When **true,** this agreement can be be used in client-only integrations

allowedHosts.description:
Hosts that can host the elastic template.

It is an error if the elastic template didn't come from one of these hosts.

declineButtonText.description: The text on the decline button.

displayName.description: The display name of the user agreement.

hasDeclineButton.description: **True** if the agreement has a decline checkbox.

mustRead.description: **True** if the user needs to scroll to the end of the document.

recordDeclineResponses.description: When **true,** this agreement records decline actions.

sendToEmail.description: **True** if send to email is applicable.

statementAlignment.description:
Position of the agreement statement. One of 

- `top`
- `bottom`

displaySettings.x-ms-summary: Information about how an agreement is displayed.

documentBase64.description: The base64-encoded contents of the document.

documentHtml.description: The HTML representation of the document.

fileExtension.description: The file extension of the document.

mustRead.description: **True** if the user needs to scroll to the end of the document.

buildBranchDeployedDateTime.description: The date-time this branch was deployed.

linkedSites.description: An array of URLs (strings) of related sites.

versionUrl.description: The URL where this version of the API can be found.

userAgreementRequest.description: Data used to create the agreement.

clientUserId.description:
A unique value that identifies a user.
You can use anything that your system uses
to identify unique users, such as
employee IDs, email addresses, and surrogate keys as the value of `clientUserId`.

A clickwrap with a specific `clientUserId` will not appear again
once it has been accepted.

documentData.description:
This property specifies the data used to create
an elastic template with [dynamic content][].

[dynamic content]: /docs/click-api/click101/customize-elastic-template-fields/#add-dynamic-content-to-your-elastic-template

metadata.description: A customer-defined string you can use in requests. This string will appear in the corresponding response.

returnUrl.description: The URL to redirect to after the agreement is complete when the agreement is not rendered in an iframe.

userAgreementRequest.x-ms-summary: Data used to create the agreement.

accountId.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

agreedOn.description:
Date that the client last completed the agreement.

This property is null if `agreementUrl` is not null and `status` is not  `agreed`.

agreementUrl.description:
When not null, an agreement is required for user specified by  `clientUserId`.

When missing the user specified by `clientUserId`
has already agreed and does not require a new acceptance.

Use this URL to render the agreement in a web page.

<!--
or redirected to when providing redirect_url as a query parameter.
-->

clickwrapId.description: The GUID of the elastic template.

clientUserId.description:
A unique value that identifies a user.
You can use anything that your system uses
to identify unique users, such as
employee IDs, email addresses, and surrogate keys as the value of `clientUserId`.

An elastic signing agreement with a specific `clientUserId` will not appear again
once it has been accepted.

consumerDisclosureEnabled.description: **True** if consumer disclosure was required by this agreement.

consumerDisclosureHtml.description: The customer-branded HTML with the Electronic Record and Signature Disclosure information

createdOn.description: The date when the elastic template was created. May be null.

declinedOn.description:
The date when the user declined the most recent required agreement.

This property is valid only when `status` is `declined`. Otherwise it is null.

documentData.description:
This property specifies the data used to create
an elastic template with [dynamic content][].

[dynamic content]: /docs/click-api/click101/customize-elastic-template-fields/#add-dynamic-content-to-your-elastic-template

metadata.description: A customer-defined string you can use in requests. This string will appear in the corresponding response.

returnUrl.description: The URL redirected to after the agreement was completed.

settings.description: The display settings for this agreement.

style.description:
This property specifies the custom style provided when the agreement was created by [customizing the template appearance][].



[customizing the template appearance]: /docs/click-api/click101/customize-elastic-template-appearance/

agreeButton.description: Control the display of the Agree button.

agreementStatement.description: Control the display of the agreement statement.

container.description: Control the overall clickwrap container and inherited styles such as font.

disclosureLink.description: Control the display of the disclosure link.

documentLink.description: Control the display of the agreement statement.

header.description: Control the display of the header.

scrollControl.description:
Control the scrolling of the document either by browser or by a scrollbar in the clickwrap shell.
Can only be applied if the clickwrap `format` is `inline`.

border.description: Control the border of the element.

color.description: Control the fore-ground color of the element.

fontFamily.description: Control the font family of the text.

fontSize.description: Control the font size of the text.

fontStyle.description: Control the font style of the text.

fontWeight.description: Control the font weight of the text.

margin.description: Control the margin of the element.

padding.description: Control the padding of the element.

textDecoration.description: Control the underline and other styles of the text.

padding.description: Control the padding of the element.

textDecoration.description: Control the underline and other styles of the text.

tags.name: ClickWraps

x-ds-categories.name: Accounts
x-ds-categories.summary: Elastic signing (also known as DocuSign Click) enables companies to capture consent to standard agreement terms with a single click.
x-ds-categories.description: Elastic signing (also known as DocuSign Click) lets you capture consent to standard agreement terms with a single click: terms and conditions, terms of service, terms of use, privacy policies, and more. The Click API lets you include this customizable solution in your DocuSign integrations.
